text: The ⸤wisest of women⸥\f + \fr 14:1 \ft Literally “wise ones of women” \f* builds her house,
but the foolish tears it down with her hands.
He who walks in uprightness fears Yahweh,
but he who is devious \add in\add* his ways displeases him.
In the mouth of a fool is the rod of pride,
but the lips of the wise preserve them.
⸤When there are no⸥\f + \fr 14:4 \ft Literally “In there is no” \f* oxen the manger is empty,
but an abundance of crops \add comes\add* by the strength of an ox.\f + \fr 14:4 \ft Hebrew “bull” \f*
A faithful witness does not lie,
but he who breathes out falsehood is a witness of deceit.
A scoffer seeks wisdom, but there is none,
but knowledge ⸤comes easily to him who understands⸥.\f + \fr 14:6 \ft Literally “to one who understands it comes easy” \f*
Leave ⸤the presence of a foolish man⸥,\f + \fr 14:7 \ft Literally “from the presence \fq belonging \ft to a man of foolishness” \f*
\add for\add* you will not \add come to\add* know ⸤words of knowledge⸥.\f + \fr 14:7 \ft Literally “lips of knowledge” \f*
The wisdom of the clever is understanding his ways,
but the folly of fools is deceit.
Fools mock\f + \fr 14:9 \ft Hebrew “he mocks” \f* \add the\add* guilt offering,
but among the upright, it is favorable.
The heart\f + \fr 14:10 \ft Or “mind” \f* knows the bitterness of its soul,\f + \fr 14:10 \ft Or “life,” or “inner self” \f*
but in its joy, it will not share itself with a stranger.
The house of the wicked will be destroyed,
but the tent of the upright will flourish.
There is a way \add that seems\add* upright ⸤to⸥\f + \fr 14:12 \ft Literally “to the face of” \f* a man,
but its end \add is\add* the way of death.
Even in laughter, a heart may be sad,
and the end of joy \add may be\add* grief.
From his ways, the perverse of heart will be satisfied,
and ⸤from his own⸥,\f + \fr 14:14 \ft Literally “from upon him” \f* \add so shall\add* a good man.
The simple will believe every word,
but the clever will consider his step.
The wise is cautious and turns from evil,
but the fool throws off restraint and is confident.
He who is short of ⸤temper⸥\f + \fr 14:17 \ft Literally “nostril” \f* will act foolishly,
and the man who schemes will be hated.
The simple are adorned \add with\add* folly,
but the clever are crowned with knowledge.
The evil bow down before the good,
and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
The poor is disliked even by his neighbor,
but the lovers of the rich are many.
He who despises his neighbor is a sinner,
but he who has mercy on the poor blesses him.
Have they not erred, those who plan evil?
But loyalty and faithfulness \add belong to\add* those who plan good.
In all toil, there is profit,
but the ⸤talk⸥\f + \fr 14:23 \ft Literally “word, matter, thing” \f* of lips \add leads\add* only to poverty.
The crown of the wise \add is\add* their wealth;
the folly of fools is folly.
He who saves lives\f + \fr 14:25 \ft Or “souls,” or “inner selves” \f* \add is\add* a witness of truth,
but he who utters lies \add is\add* a betrayer.
In the fear of Yahweh, there is confidence of strength,
and for his children, there will be refuge.
The fear of Yahweh \add is\add* a fountain of life,
\add in order\add* to turn from the snares of death.
In the multitude of people is the glory of the king,
but without a population, a prince \add is\add* ruined.
\add He who is\add* slow to anger \add has\add* great understanding,
but the hasty of spirit\f + \fr 14:29 \ft Or “breath” \f* exalts folly.
A heart\f + \fr 14:30 \ft Or “mind” \f* of tranquility\f + \fr 14:30 \ft Or “he who heals” \f* \add is\add* life \add to the\add* flesh,
but causes bones of passion to rot.
He who oppresses the poor insults him who made him,
but he who has mercy on the poor honors him.
By his evildoing, the wicked will be overthrown,
and the righteous will find refuge in his death.
In the heart\f + \fr 14:33 \ft Or “mind” \f* of him who has understanding, wisdom rests,
but \add even\add* in the midst of fools it becomes known.
Righteousness will exalt a nation,
but sin \add is\add* a reproach to a people.
The favor of a king \add is\add* for the servant who deals wisely,
but his wrath will be \add on\add* him who acts shamefully.
